alert.note: Alert for Lake; Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 6:47AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northwest California, including the following counties, in central California, Lake. In northwest California, Mendocino. * WHEN...Until 945 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen in a short amount of time. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ukiah, Lakeport, Upper Lake, Ukiah Municipal Airport, Middletown, Clearlake, North Lakeport, Finley, Soda Bay, Saratoga Springs, Witter Springs, Glenhaven, Mount Konocti, Knobcone Camp, Konocti Bay, Hopland, Hough Springs, Loch Lomond, Adams and Seigler Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
